news_header: Mauri Upper Kotola, a lecturer at the University of Lapland, was suspended in October due to confusion surrounding his employment status, which officially ended on November 1.
news_text: Mauri Upper Kotola, a lecturer at the University of Lapland, faced suspension in October amid confusion regarding his employment relationship with the university. An email from the Faculty of Arts confirmed that his employment would end on November 1. His lectures were suspended on October 23, and he had served as the university's director from 2006 to 2019. Recently, he was in the spotlight for his involvement in a controversial dissertation directed by Lauri Törhönen, which raised concerns about violations of Good Scientific Language. However, the university president concluded that there was no guilt in the matter.
